alert.note: Alert for Bryan; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 7:48AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Bryan and central Marshall Counties through 830 AM CST... At 747 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northeast of Callisburg, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Durant, Kingston, Silo, Mead, Willis, Woodville, Little City, Lake Texoma, Cartwright, Calera and Mcbride. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
